term.title: measurement reproducibility

item.text: Measurement precision under reproducibility conditions of measurement.

notes.item: Relevant statistical terms are given in ISO 5725-1 and ISO 5725-2.
The term "interlaboratory precision" or "between-laboratory precision" is sometimes used as a synonym of measurement reproducibility.

sources.item: PAC, 2021, 93, 997. 'Metrological and quality concepts in analytical chemistry (IUPAC Recommendations 2021)' on page 1012 (https://doi.org/10.1515/pac-2019-0819)

term.citation: Citation: 'measurement reproducibility' in IUPAC Compendium of Chemical Terminology, 5th ed. International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry; 2025. Online version 5.0.0, 2025. 10.1351/goldbook.08031

term.disclaimer: The International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry (IUPAC) is continuously reviewing and, where needed, updating terms in the Compendium of Chemical Terminology (the IUPAC Gold Book). Users of these terms are encouraged to include the version of a term with its use and to check regularly for updates to term definitions that you are using.
